line_1: A boy knock'd at my door, I awoke with the noise,
line_2: Who is it, I said, who is it that my rest thus destroys

line_1: Who is it, I said, who is it that my rest thus destroys
line_2: A boy knock'd at my door, I awoke with the noise,

line_1: He answered so softly, so gently, so mild,
line_2: I am a poor little unfortunate child;

line_1: I am a poor little unfortunate child;
line_2: He answered so softly, so gently, so mild,

line_1: Its a cold rainy night, I am wet to the skin,
line_2: And I have lost my way, so pray let me in.

line_1: And I have lost my way, so pray let me in.
line_2: Its a cold rainy night, I am wet to the skin,

line_1: In compassion I rose, and striking a light,
line_2: I open'd the door, when a boy stood in sight

line_1: I open'd the door, when a boy stood in sight
line_2: In compassion I rose, and striking a light,

line_1: He had wings on his shoulders, the rain from them drip'd,
line_2: And with bow and with arrows the boy was equip'd

line_1: And with bow and with arrows the boy was equip'd
line_2: He had wings on his shoulders, the rain from them drip'd,

line_1: I stir'd up my fire, set him down by my side,
line_2: And with a warm napkin the wet from him dry'd

line_1: And with a warm napkin the wet from him dry'd
line_2: I stir'd up my fire, set him down by my side,

line_1: I chal'd him all o'er, to keep out the cold air,
line_2: And I wrung with my hands the wet from his hair.

line_1: And I wrung with my hands the wet from his hair.
line_2: I chal'd him all o'er, to keep out the cold air,

line_1: No sooner from wet and from cold he found ease,
line_2: Then he took up the bow and said, Ma'am, if you please,

line_1: Then he took up the bow and said, Ma'am, if you please,
line_2: No sooner from wet and from cold he found ease,

line_1: Iwould fain, with your leave, by experiment know,
line_2: Ifthe rain has not damag'd the strings of my bow.

line_1: Ifthe rain has not damag'd the strings of my bow.
line_2: Iwould fain, with your leave, by experiment know,

line_1: Then straight from his quiver an arrow he drew.
line_2: Which he aim'd at my heart, and twang went the yew.

line_1: Which he aim'd at my heart, and twang went the yew.
line_2: Then straight from his quiver an arrow he drew.

line_1: My bow is undamag'd, said he, and my dart,
line_2: And you will find trouble in bearing the smart.
